protein.specific_function: Converts lysophosphatidic acid (LPA) into phosphatidic acid by incorporating an acyl moiety at the sn-2 position of the glycerol backbone. Acts on LPA containing saturated or unsaturated fatty acids C16:0-C20:4 at the sn-1 position using C18:1, C20:4 or C18:2-CoA as the acyl donor. Also acts on lysophosphatidylcholine, lysophosphatidylinositol and lysophosphatidylserine using C18:1 or C20:4-CoA.

go_class.description: transferase activity, transferring acyl groups other than amino-acyl groups

reference.reference_text: Leung DW: The structure and functions of human lysophosphatidic acid acyltransferases. Front Biosci. 2001 Aug 1;6:D944-53.
